contenido.en:
Jesus Christ is not merely a prophet or wise man. According to the Bible, he is the only-begotten Son of God, created by Jehovah before everything else and sent to Earth as the promised Messiah. He is not Almighty God‚Äîas many Trinitarian churches teach‚Äîbut God's chief spokesperson and first creation.

üîπ Preexistence: Jesus existed before coming to Earth
> ‚ÄúBefore Abraham came into existence, I have been.‚Äù ‚Äî John 8:58 (more accurately translated from Greek as 'I have been' or 'I existed')
This does not imply eternity but rather preexistence, as confirmed in Proverbs 8:22‚Äì30 and Colossians 1:15‚Äì17.

üîπ Created by God: Not co-eternal or co-equal
> ‚ÄúHe is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation.‚Äù ‚Äî Colossians 1:15
The Greek word ‚Äúprototokos‚Äù means ‚Äúfirstborn,‚Äù which in this context refers to order of creation, not rank.

üîπ Not God: Clear distinction between Jesus and the Father
> ‚ÄúThe Father is greater than I am.‚Äù ‚Äî John 14:28
> ‚ÄúI am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.‚Äù ‚Äî John 20:17
Even after his resurrection, Jesus still called Jehovah ‚Äúmy God.‚Äù

üîπ The Logos (Word) is not God Himself
> ‚ÄúIn the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was [a] god.‚Äù ‚Äî John 1:1
The Greek lacks a definite article before ‚ÄúGod‚Äù in the final clause, indicating the Word was godlike or divine, not ‚Äúthe God.‚Äù

üîπ Jesus prayed and obeyed
> ‚ÄúFather... not my will, but yours be done.‚Äù ‚Äî Luke 22:42
A distinct will means distinct identities, not one and the same person.

üîπ Spurious or altered texts
‚Ä¢ 1 John 5:7 ‚Äî ‚ÄúThree bear record in heaven‚Ä¶‚Äù (older KJV translations)
‚Üí This phrase is not found in early Greek manuscripts. It was added later and is missing in authoritative sources like Codex Sinaiticus and Vaticanus.

üîπ Jesus is the means through whom Jehovah created all things
> ‚ÄúBy means of him all things were created...‚Äù ‚Äî Colossians 1:16; John 1:3
This makes Jesus the agent of creation, not the Supreme Creator.

üîπ He did not accept worship as God
> ‚ÄúWorship Jehovah your God, and serve him only.‚Äù ‚Äî Matthew 4:10
Jesus always directed worship to Jehovah.

üîπ Jesus is Savior, but Jehovah is the source of salvation
> ‚ÄúGod sent his Son‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äî 1 John 4:9
Jesus carries out the ransom plan, but Jehovah is its originator.

‚úÖ Conclusion
Jesus is the Son of God, not God himself. He was created, sent, and exalted by Jehovah. He is the promised Messiah, the Mediator between God and mankind, and our future King. Denying his role is a mistake; deifying him is a distortion.
